alert.note: Alert for Northern Bristol; Southern Bristol (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:14AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Bristol, northern Washington, Newport and southeastern Bristol Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 512 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fishers Island to 22 miles south of Block Island. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Torrential rainfall can also be expected. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... New Bedford, Fall River, Dartmouth, South Kingstown, North Kingstown, Newport, Bristol, Westerly, Somerset, Portsmouth, Middletown, Fairhaven, Narragansett, Swansea, Tiverton, Westport, Warren, Freetown, Hopkinton and Charlestown. Those attending the events in Newport are in the path of these storms and should prepare for strong thunderstorms. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
